results.abstract: Article discusses how Dr Max A Geller acquired control of Yoo-Hoo Chocolate Beverage Corp; illus of sr vp Dr Eric B Hotelling (S)

headline.main: People/Business; Yoo-Hoo: A Carlstadt Success Story

results.snippet: According to Dr. Max A. Geller, he became involved in the soft-drink industry "largely by accident." It happened in 1960, when he acquired control of the thenfledgling Yoo-Hoo Chocolate Beverage Corporation.
results.lead_paragraph: According to Dr. Max A. Geller, he became involved in the soft-drink industry "largely by accident." It happened in 1960, when he acquired control of the thenfledgling Yoo-Hoo Chocolate Beverage Corporation.

results.abstract: article on agency which was created 7 wks ago to coordinate and direct all Govt's activities in energy research and development; Robert C Seamans is admr (L)
results.snippet: WASHINGTON--In a town where Scrabble with agecny names often becomes a Governmental game for concealing problems, a new bureaucratic conglomerate has emerged with a broad, still nebulous mandate for solving the nation's energy problems.
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON--In a town where Scrabble with agecny names often becomes a Governmental game for concealing problems, a new bureaucratic conglomerate has emerged with a broad, still nebulous mandate for solving the nation's energy problems.

results.abstract: Charles Schulz comic strip Peanuts, which appears in French in France-Soir, is popular with Parisians; in recent mos 500,000 Peanuts T-shirts have been sold, 6 paperback books and 3 hard backs have been breaking sales records; strip is translated by Michel Perez and is distrubted by United Feature Syndicate; Robert Ahier, syndicate spokesman, comments; cartoon illus (M)

headline.main: 'Peanuts' Bridges a Language Gap and Captivates the French

results.snippet: PARIS, March 25-Zut et grands dieux! -- Rats and good grief!

byline.original: By NAN ROBERTSON Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: PARIS, March 25-Zut et grands dieux! -- Rats and good grief!

results.abstract: Western observers predict USSR will launch 2-man Soyuz space spacecraft within next several days for mission of long duration, possibly to further study effects of prolonged space flights on human body; say next mission probably will involve rendezvous with orbiting Salyut space station (M)

headline.main: Soviet Expected to Begin Manned Space Mission

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 27 Knowledgeable observers in the United States think it likely that the Soviet Union will launch a two-man Soyuz spacecraft within the next several days for a mission of long duration.

byline.original: By HAROLD M. SCHMECK Jr. Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 27 Knowledgeable observers in the United States think it likely that the Soviet Union will launch a two-man Soyuz spacecraft within the next several days for a mission of long duration.
